recipe.name: Jell-O Marshmallow Fondant
recipe.author: Penolopy Bulnick
recipe.description: A colorful and flavorful twist on marshmallow fondant using Jell-O mix for both color and taste. Easy to make and perfect for rainbow fondant creations.
optional_supplies: Silpat Mat (recommended for kneading and easy cleanup)

steps.title: Initial Mixing
steps.instructions: Combine marshmallows, water, and Jell-O mix in a microwave-safe bowl. If Jell-O grains are large, process to a fine powder first. Microwave on half power for 50 seconds, stir, then another 45 seconds. Mix until melted and smooth. Watch closely as it will puff up.

steps.title: Bring on the Sugar!
steps.instructions: Gradually sift powdered sugar into the melted mixture, stirring until it starts to form a ball. When it holds shape and no longer melts down, transfer to a sugar-dusted surface or Silpat mat. Knead gently, adding more powdered sugar as needed, until non-sticky. Wrap and store until use.

steps.title: Use and Enjoy
steps.instructions: If fondant becomes too tough, reduce sugar next time or test different Jell-O flavors. Cherry flavor tends to stiffen more. For stronger flavor, add extra Jell-O mix. Berry Blue is highly recommended for taste and color.

notes: You can divide the marshmallow base and mix with different Jell-O flavors for a rainbow fondant set.
Taste and texture can vary by flavor; adjust powdered sugar and mix times as needed.
